### History of AP-LS For over 50 years the American Psychology-Law Society, Division 41, has been the premiere organization for students and professionals who are interested in issues at the intersection of psychology and law.

Learn more
::: ::: ::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4} ::: {#card-first-color .card .h-100} ::: {.card-body .d-flex .flex-column}

### Careers in Law-Psychology Psychologists can pursue a number of specialties within the area of psychology and law. Watch a recent panel discussion about careers in applied psychology and law.

Video
::: ::: ::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4} ::: {#card-first-color .card .h-100} ::: {.card-body .d-flex .flex-column}

### For Students The AP-LS Student Committee has compiled a variety of resources and information for undergraduate and graduate level students.

Visit site
::: ::: ::: ::: ::: vspace ::: ::: {.column-screen .home-section} ::: {.column .col-v-center width="15%"} ::: ::: {.column .col-v-center width="70%"} ::: portrait ![](about/presidents/barry_rosenfeld.jpg) ::: ::: vspace ::: ## Welcome from Our President ::: president-intro

Welcome to the American Psychology-Law Society (AP-LS), Division 41 of the American Psychological Association.

Our organizational mission is to "enhance well-being, justice, and human rights through the science and practice of psychology in legal contexts". AP-LS is the premiere organization for students and professionals who are interested in issues at the intersection of psychology and law.

As an organization, we strive to support our members in their work using psychological science and practice to advance justice in our legal system.
